pageContext.analysis: Trump appeared to be citing a daily tracking poll by Rasmussen, which consistently has a Republican-leaning bias. The polling gurus at FiveThirtyEight say that an adjusted rating would have shown Trump at 46 percent in the poll. On the day of this interview, Trump had an average approval of 41.2 percent in 538's blended poll rating, along with 53.6 percent disapproval.
